akn:subsection.akn:heading: Authority of Institute; purposes of grants

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Authority of Institute; purposes of grants The Institute is authorized to award grants and enter into cooperative agreements or contracts, in a manner consistent with subsection (b), in order to—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Priority in making awards; alternative recipients; approval of applications; receipt and administration of funds; accountability

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Priority in making awards; alternative recipients; approval of applications; receipt and administration of funds; accountability The Institute is empowered to award grants and enter into cooperative agreements or contracts as follows:
(c) Permissible uses of funds Funds available pursuant to grants, cooperative agreements, or contracts awarded under this section may be used—

(d) Matching fund requirements The Institute shall incorporate in any grant, cooperative agreement, or contract awarded under this section in which a State or local court (or other unit of State or local government) is the recipient, the requirement that the recipient provide a match, from private or public sources, not less than 50 per centum of the total cost of such grant, cooperative agreement, or contract, except that such requirement may be waived in exceptionally rare circumstances upon the approval of the chief justice of the highest court of the State and a majority of the Board of Directors.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Compliance monitoring and evaluation by Institute

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Compliance monitoring and evaluation by Institute The Institute shall monitor and evaluate, or provide for independent evaluations of, programs supported in whole or in part under this chapter to ensure that the provisions of this chapter, the bylaws of the Institute, and the applicable rules, regulations, and guidelines promulgated pursuant to this chapter, are carried out.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Independent study of financial and technical assistance programs

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Independent study of financial and technical assistance programs The Institute shall provide for an independent study of the financial and technical assistance programs under this chapter.
